website_summaries.verdict: A quality-built shredder with an innovative and effective waste basket design.
pros: The narrow waste bin makes emptying an easy, mess-free experience
Auto-stop feature protects machine from overheating
LED indicator alerts you if paper is misaligned
Strong steel teeth handle credit cards and CDs without jamming or overheating
Shredder runs quieter than most models
cons: A bit on the heavier side, this shredder is awkward to move

customer_reviews.title: Eight months later and it's still great!
customer_reviews.text: Price point is great for all the things it shreds including dossiers, DVDs of pee pee videos, bribes from the Russians, you name it. I'd really like to shred the NetGear WIFI Extender with it, which was a piece of junk from Amazon that ate up my whole day with tech support. But whether you're trying to avoid federal prison by destroying incriminating treasonous documents or you're simply cleaning out your file cabinet, this shredder won't disappoint. I've had it for 8 months now, and so far no jury has been able to convict me!
customer_reviews.author: Princess Bubblegum

customer_reviews.title: Won't do 8 sheets, but the shreds are tiny!
customer_reviews.text: Minus one star to every shredder from every manufacturer for exaggerating their capacity. No way this shredder can handle 8 sheets of anything but the thinnest rice paper. I put in 6 sheets of junk mail, it started to groan. But the reverse switch worked as intended and nothing jammed. Other than that, it's a great product for the price. We've only put 50 pages through it so far, but the shreds are so tiny it makes strip shredders look silly. Take a look at the photo-tiny shreds. Happy purchaser.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Millman

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: The shredder was delivered to my house on August 7th 2018 and now it no longer works on August 17th 2018. I only shredded paper in it two times before today. Now this morning I tried to one thing in the shredder would not move or power on. I even moved it around the house to change plugs and make sure it wasn't the outlet. It's just not working. Only had the product for 10 days use it 2 times and it doesn't work anymore. I knew the price was too good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica L. Wanzo

customer_reviews.title: Arrived USED. nicely compact though.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived used (was a surprise because I'd ordered NEW). The inside box was clearly cut open and there was dirt dust and paper inside the basket and blades. But it is functioning (and seems to work okay). The design is nicely compact, and the handle to lift off the heavy top is very useful (my old shredder did not have a handle, it was awkward to lift off the top with both hands while trying to steady the basket). My disappointment with this shredder has more to do with it being used more than it's functionality. Time will tell. I will update.
customer_reviews.author: Just meTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: I'm irritated
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today and the box had a couple of puncture holes, which I thought was strange, considering it was in ANOTHER box, for me to get to it. Then, took it out to put it together, I realized this is NOT NEW, it's used! It must have been a return or something! There are greasy fingerprints all over it, the basket has paper residue in the bottom and when I turned it over, there was unreleased strips of paper in the blades!! If I pay this much for something that is supposed to be brand new, it BETTER be new! So returning this!
customer_reviews.author: S. Azzouz

customer_reviews.title: Update
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this shredder its a very poor design. Worked well the first time used, but the second time it locked up and the motor just makes a spinning sound and the shredding jaws do not move. Removed the whole jam and it worked for a second and the motor just spins again. Upon review the motor uses a steel worm gear (looks like a drill bit) to spin a large plastic gear. When it jammed it cut a hole on the side of the plastic gear and whenever it rotates to that point it fails. Really???? Metal driving plastic when has that ever worked. Engineered to fail. Shameful.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Aurora AU820MA , 8 Sheet Schredder.  Great choice.
customer_reviews.text: My old shredder, also an Aurora, was a strip type. Filled the basket and bags fast. This new machine is much more efficient, creating tiny pcs. It is very fast and shreds paper, credit cards and discs very well. It does make a little more noise but works harder. I am very satisfied with this machine and recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Billy B

customer_reviews.title: Best micro cut shredder
customer_reviews.text: Awesome smaller shredder. Shredded pieces are tiny, the P4 micro cut shred size is exactly what you need for security purposes. The shredder teeth are made of steel and made for the long haul. This shredder is very quiet relative to the job of shredding. Other reviewers have stated it is noisy, however I found mine to be very quiet comparatively speaking. The pull out basket is a must in a home shredder with the basket moving in and out easily. Wheels under the shredder makes moving it easy. The all black design looks good as well. Outstanding purchase. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: IndianaJ

customer_reviews.title: USED!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received this today and it has clearly been USED. Paper still stuck in the shredder and paper “dust” on the inside basket. There are wear lines on the inside of the basket and glass window where the bottom of the shredder rubbed. I saw another buyer had the same problem. I’m not even going to plug it in - going back!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Happy in Las Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Died during first use
customer_reviews.text: I an very dissatisfied with this product. Upon receiving it, I used it only once before it locked up. Less than 100 pages shredded. I was happy to see that Aurora has online instructional videos on how to troubleshoot it, and I tried all of the tips there. When those didn’t work, I sent an email, including pictures and receipt, to the support email. That was a month ago, I’ve received no response. At this point, I’m chalking it up as a loss and will buy another brand. Maybe it was a lemon, but I wouldn’t trust it if you are looking for a shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Zeigler

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: World great! I actually happened to buy this shredder because the original one that I bought from a different brand was a dud. I’m very happy with this one. It shreds into very small pieces and has a nice safety lid.
customer_reviews.author: Naishmarie Lucas

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for every day mail shredding. This is not for people that have allot of shredding. This is more for personal use and not for office continuous shredding. It is small but does the work perfect. I like the way it micro shreds. I mainly bought it for shredding of personal information that I get in the mail. I would sure recommend it. Also, just a little hack for plant lovers - I like to use the shredding to fill the bottom of my plant pots so it won't require that much soil.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Not a bargain
customer_reviews.text: The old saying, "you get what you pay for" is true with this item. It works great....at first, but at the first sign of a jam, it's almost impossible to rectify, and the way it's constructed makes it almost impossible to retrieve any clogged paper to get the machine working again. It's a shame because even though I never put more than HALF the recommended allotted number of paper, it still jammed within a week of using. After returning the item twice, I have to, unfortunately, strongly suggest you don't purchase this product, which is a shame since it DID a marvelous job of micro-shredding.
customer_reviews.author: Judith M. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, perfect price
customer_reviews.text: I was a little bit afraid to buy a shredder for this price but I am pleasantly surprised. I am not using it really daily but may be every third day and it works for already 3 months without single issue. It shreds credit card without any problems. I have not tried DVD yet. What ever you shred is shredded to such a small pieces that there is no way anybody can put it together. This is 100% secure system. I can strongly recommend it! Excellent product and perfect price!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Pasadena

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking product!  Just doesn't Last!
customer_reviews.text: I like the look. I have properly maintained my shredder as I have used a shredder for years. But this one already stopped working. I have tried all options to get it started again but it will not turn on. I have hardly used it so I know iI did not burn it up. I would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S Yokoyama

customer_reviews.title: I had a shreader for 10 years... an Executive.
customer_reviews.text: I broke the executive by putting cellophane in it.. ( my Mistake ) or it would still be working.. I bought this o0ne after doing the research.. it works better than the executive and is much quieter.. The design of this one is better also. Both the old and new shreader are micro cross cut, but the new one is even finer.. Dont think anyone could put together shreader from either. I have to empty this one less frequently.. Iv had the shreader for about a month and it seems to be very good.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Jams paper on Reverse
customer_reviews.text: Within second use I had to use it in reverse mode and then paper would not shred when feeding normally. When I finally realized what it was it was that if you put on reverse mode to loosen paper and you put back on normal feed mode there was some paper that got stuck. I had to use skinny metal wire to clear the teeth mechnism, since paper would not go thru to shred, frustrating but when cleared up on shredding area then it started to work again. Now its working so just dont feed fast and should be fine. Its an ok shredder!
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Within 10 minutes of using, it was warm to the touch, it died and triggered the Overheat button
customer_reviews.text: I bought this during my shelter in place time. It's an 8 sheet shredder-though the max number of sheets I even attempted was 4 and based on the noises from the machine, it sounded like that was a challenge. Within 10 minutes of starting to shred, the Overheat button was lit and it was DOA. I came back to it about 2 hours later, started to shred again, and again it died. I walked away to write this review, but my advice to you would be to purchase a different shredder. It's cheap but if it doesn't do the job, what's the point.
customer_reviews.author: nkennedy

customer_reviews.title: Super powerful and small
customer_reviews.text: I chose this model because it was small and less expensive than other models. Was I right! This thing is very powerful and shreds paper very fine. My purchase was twofold. I needed to get rid of papers from years back but the shreds will serve as bedding/flooring in my chicken coop. The shred is very fine so it's good for the chickens to walk on. Note: I only shred four or five sheets at a time but it's so fast that it went quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kcutsone

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this shredder I loved it. It worked as expected. However, after 6 months of very light use, it started to smell like smoke. I called Aurora's customer service but that was a waste of time. They wanted a video sent to them of the shredder in operation. I explained that I can't video "smell". I was assured that the machine would not catch on fire. Really? I am supposed to believe that when the burning smell is so strong. I am afraid to use it. It was clear to me that they were not going to help me. I am trashing the shredder and buying a different brand. Thanks for nothing Aurora.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Gets The Job Done
customer_reviews.text: A lot of bang for the buck. We recently cleaned out one of our file cabinets & had A LOT of files needing to be shredded. Well I overstuffed our previous one & ordered this little guy. Can overheat if used continuesly for a longer period of time but has an indicator & is ready to go again after 30 minutes. Spent about 2 hours total yesterday shredding documents, emptied it three-four time & it handled it all like a beast. Was a little weary with some of the negative comments but overall very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: David Washburn

customer_reviews.title: Seems like an adequate Shredder
customer_reviews.text: We were surprised that this is a fairly noisy device, and it's doubtful that it can actually shred 8-pages at a time. After minimal use, it also seemed to overheat and shut-off quicker than we expected. The collection bin that is provided is pretty small, and the auto-ON keeps the shredder running a bit longer (and noisily) than we'd like. The good news, though, is that it does a fine job of shredding things into small pieces, and that is exactly what we were looking for in a new Shredder. FYI -- our last (Memorex-brand) Shredder lasted 16 years, so we're hoping this generic-brand will come close to the same longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Walter

customer_reviews.title: Ordered this brand based on reviews.  Would not work.  On toggling back and forth a spark happened.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this shredder based on reviews. Arrived plugged in, did not work. Played with the toggle back and forth and finally got it working. Needed a rest to cool down. Came back 3 hours later and again would not start. Toggled it back and forth. Spark happened at the toggle. Unplugged the shredder and immediately packaged it for return. My Fellows died after 15 years of usage. This one was the replacement and it did not work on day one.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted something that would cut things up into very small pieces and this was the cheapest option I could find. I really assumed there would end up being something misleading about it, but it does micro shred. I usually only feed one sheet at a time, I could see how this could manage to get jammed if you do too many sheets. I’ve been feeding it mostly old post it notes and old cards, without issue!
customer_reviews.author: Kat Y

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted One Year
customer_reviews.text: This product did a good job shredding but the auto off only lasted 13 months. Now, I need to turn it on and off each time I want to shred. This is a personal use shredder not for commercial use. So it should last much longer. Customer support at Aurora was basically useless. I performed all the procedures they suggested to fix the problem with no success. All they had to say after that was "well, you are just going to have to turn it on and off when you need to use it". Obviously, this is an example of cheap Chinese junk being peddled by an American company who do not wish to take responsibly for supporting the products.
customer_reviews.author: camaro1946

customer_reviews.title: AVOID....Will not cut off!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The shredder worked great for 7 months. Now when in AUTO it continuously runs. Have tried blowing out the senor area with can air to make sure no paper dust is clogging the senor, but that was no help. Until now our office has always liked our 8 Aurora shredders. Unless this MAJOR defect/issue can be resolved or patched our organization will look elsewhere for future shredder needs.
customer_reviews.author: sm

customer_reviews.title: Durable shredder that is resistant to jamming
customer_reviews.text: This shredder is significantly more powerful and effective than the 6 sheet shredders I've owned. Wife and I cleaned out and shredded 3 file cabinets worth of paper in one week. I don't ever put more than 2-4 pages at a time as more than that will strain most 8 page and under shredders. We used this for 5-6 minutes at a time at least 20-30 times per day and this model handled it like a champ. Amazingly it never jammed. My 6 page shredders would jam so often that it really slowed the whole process down.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Should Have Bought it Sooner
customer_reviews.text: I have powered through several YEARS of shredding since I got this a few weeks ago. I never pitch anything with my name and address on it, so I had a huge amount of shredding that I wasn't sure what to do with. I've filled three grocery bags with shredding so far... that might not sound like a lot, but it's a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Jes

customer_reviews.title: Best Shredder I ever used
customer_reviews.text: If Ron Popiel was still around he'd sell this as the shred-a-matic. This thing slices, dices, cuts, and shreds like nothing I've ever seen. Fantastic product, it came in the original packaging unscathed from shipping. This thing could shred all of Hillary's e-mails without blinking an eye. Order one today.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: This one is the way to go.
customer_reviews.text: Micro cut is the only way to go, and for the price this one can’t be beat. I had about three years worth of documents and old bills I needed to get rid of and it took me around an hour or so. The motor is strong and not so loud, the size is perfect for my office set up and doesn’t bad at all under my desk. I’m well satisfied with my purchase and I will recommend this to my peoples... 💯
customer_reviews.author: CarlostosWay

customer_reviews.title: Functional micro-shredder for very small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this shredder if you're looking for a micro-cut shredder (much better than strip cut shredders) for very small home / office jobs. Though this shredder states that it can handle 6 sheets at a time, mine seemed to struggle even at 2-3 sheets, so I would not recommend that. This said, as long as you don't have a ton of shredding to do, this shredder does cut the documents into micro size bits - so I feel really secure disposing of anything that goes through it. For very small home office jobs, a very decent (but noisy) shredder that ensures documents disposed of through this device remain private.
customer_reviews.author: Adam R.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to dispose of old tax files and old client files. I am disappointed in the size of the waste container. I know the description said 4 gallon but still pictured something bigger that this is. I guess I am accustom to old shredders with large bins that did not hold much either because the paper strips filled it quickly as well. For small house hold security of confidential documents this micro cut shredder is fine. No one will try to piece the document back together. It is a great little shredder. For me it is smaller than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie in PA

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid
customer_reviews.text: Feels nice & hefty (which also makes it top-heavy, but a lot of these are). Quieter than the cheapo units of past that I'm used to but would still wake someone up. It most certainly doesn't take 8 pages at a time. Mine starts bogging down a bit with 3 & 4 is probably the max I'd try. This is with standard weight, regular paper.. nothing heavy or special about it. For my casual use, I don't particularly care, but just an FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Aurora shredder
customer_reviews.text: This shredder is light duty. Only a few pieces of paper at a time can be inserted. It over heats easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Lay

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought in April and died in September after using sparingly. I know shredders can overheat so I was always careful to use for only short spurts. I was using it recently and I stopped after few minutes. When I returned to shred more, it would not start. It's dead and waste of money. Also, I don't like that you have to remove the entire top, including the motor, just to empty it. I would not recommend this shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Powerhouse for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a surprisingly sharp paper shredder and can shred 3 to 4 pages at a time depending on the thickness of the paper. It doesn’t overheat unless you overfeed more than 3 to 4 sheets of paper or feed too quickly. I am actually moving next month and I have already gone through eight years plus of tax papers +50 journals many old photos plus 10-15 CDs. I have some more to shred and it’s really a powerhouse of a shredder! I would recommend this for your shredding needs.
customer_reviews.author: Salubrious

customer_reviews.title: Falsely Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This machine does a good job shredding credit cards. The biggest problem I have with this machine is that it is advertised to shred up to 8 sheets at a time, and it does not. You can hear the motor having a hard time grinding and feeding in at 6 sheets of paper, and often gets stuck. The unit gets hot quickly, after about 2 minutes of shredding, and requires a 10 min cool down. I would not recommend this product unless you plan to spend a day shredding page by page and waiting for unit to cool down time after time.
customer_reviews.author: jason yeh

customer_reviews.title: DURABLE
customer_reviews.text: I DON'T REMEMBER HOW LONG THAT I HAVE HAD THIS SHREDDER THAT I USE MAINLY FOR JUNK MAIL THAT I GET EVERY DAY, IT HAS TO BE 4 OR 5 YEARS AT LEAST. I USE IT EVERY DAY FOR SOMETHING. I AM CLEANING OUT FILES AND JUST FINISHED A FULL WEEK TO SHRED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FROM ABOUT 10 YEARS. THE SHREDDER RAN CONSTANTLY FOR 7 DAYS FOR ABOUT 6 HOURS/DAY. I USUALY GET 6 TO 8 PIECES OF MAIL SIX DAYS A WEEK SO THE AVERAGE TIME TO RUN THE SHREDDER IS JUST A FEW MINUTES. I WILL BUY ANOTHER ONE OF THE SAME.
customer_reviews.author: BigAl

customer_reviews.title: Broken in 8months!!!
customer_reviews.text: DONT BUY THIS!!! It worked for only 8months before breaking. I used this about once a week to shred a couple pieces of mail- not heavy daily use. I only had to dump the container once before it stopped working. It powers on and the motor makes noise like it is functioning but the shredding tines will not turn and will not draw paper down. I cleaned it, I made sure it was not jammed, and NOPE-NOTHING! This is NOT worth the money for less than a year of use!
customer_reviews.author: SassFaceSis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: Many reviews of cheapo shredders are pretty bad, but most of the reviews for this one are very good. I have to agree. I just shredded through a decent sized pile of accumulated junk that I didn't want to throw in the trash and this thing ran like a champ. Decent speed, not too noisy, no jams so far, no overheating, and it shreds paper into tiny pieces. It does slow noticeably when you try to feed several pages at once, but feeding about 4 pages at a time works well. I did not try any credit cards or CDs. Overall, it does exactly what I need it to do for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This paper shredder is great! I bought it to keep in my home office and just used it for the first time tonight. Like other reviewers said, I wouldn’t try to fill it with 8 pieces of paper, but it handled 4-5 well. I also love that it shreds credit cards. Be mindful that the instructions specifically provide that you shouldn’t put in paper that has an adhesive on it. I wouldn’t recommend putting staplers in there either. Altogether, this is such a great product and the price is so much more reasonable compared to others I’ve seen. I like that it shreds in multiple tiny pieces versus the typical rows of paper. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: T728

customer_reviews.title: Great shredder at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This shredder definitely does the job. It’s small and easy to store in a corner. As you can see in the picture the papers looked as if they’ve been shredded multiple times. We even put it to the test by shredding 8-10 pages at a time depending on the thickness of the paper and it didn’t over heat like other shredders tend to. This is recommended for those who like to have compact items that don’t take up much space and still get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Elly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shredder unfortunately the handle just broke off.
customer_reviews.text: I requested a replacement for an identical product from Amazon and I'm very happy to say that I will be receiving the replacement 2 days after I filed the exchange. This micro-shredder is really very good and heavy duty in my opinion compared to the crappy shredder it replaced. I was just surprised that lifting the shredder from its top handle simple broke off when I was trying to empty the bin. Other than this unfortunate incident I was happy with my purchase. I hope that was just a fluke on that particular order.
customer_reviews.author: El Kabong

customer_reviews.title: Really nice micro shredder.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an inexpensive crosscut shredder that had died with this one. Very impressed! It's easy to operate, rather quiet, cuts TINY pieces from everything. The feed opening is very narrow, so care is required. But that's not a real problem. I've inserted as many as 5 sheets at one time with no issues. I doubt it would really do 8. For the occasional home use this seems to be a really good choice.
customer_reviews.author: RuCYnic

customer_reviews.title: Super good shredder!
customer_reviews.text: Love the microcut on this! And got it for a good price! Only gave this 4 stars because it was much louder than the previous Amazon Basics shredder I bought before this one, which is much quieter in comparison. Nonetheless it is good quality, heavy duty shredder that really turns all your documents into funfetti! I am considering looking for one that is a bit more quiet, but for the meantime, it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: xsheenah!

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Micro-Cut Shredder
customer_reviews.text: I received this shredder about two weeks ago and have been using it almost every other day or third day. It sure cut the document into small pieces as it describe. At this time, I am very please with the shredder and the price I paid for it. It does the work I needed and yes it's a little noise but it's not like you are constantly shredding paper because if you do you my as well purchase a heavy duty / professional shredder. Overall, I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: W. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: First off I would be giving the microshredder 5 stars, BUT it did come in used. Which I'm assuming the manufacturer tested the shredder before shipping it to the Amazon warehouse (did some looking at the multiple shipping labels on the box. When I first opened the shredder there was still pieces of paper stuck in the blades as well as in the basket. That was the only issue. Other than that - I've been using it every week and haven't had any issues with it. I've used it to shred old credit cards as well and haven't had any issues doing that either. The shredder itself shreds VERY well, so I highly reccomend the microshredder.
customer_reviews.author: Nami San

customer_reviews.title: didn't last
customer_reviews.text: After about 6 months of light use, it died on us. Very disappointing. When it was working I was really happy with the quality of the cutting and everything else about it. Unfortunately, one day it just stopped working. We are empty nesters so I know our kids weren't doing any power shredding. I think we got a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Petsittermichelle

customer_reviews.title: You can't put the papers back together!
customer_reviews.text: I strongly recommend . You can shred more papers with less space than any other shredder. Great mico cut, there is no way anyone can put the shredded pieces back together. Great value
customer_reviews.author: Tia

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this item February 18 2020.  brand new  I have used it 4 times with paper only 4 sheets
customer_reviews.text: the AuroraAU870sheet Micro cut today is 3 month we have it last night I was cutting papers and started to make a weird noise it over heated and stop after it quit and 1/2 hr waiting started again and the noise was bigger and got hot again and stop with 3 papers or two only I never used the shredded with the 8 pages advertise I need a return paper to sed it back .
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Good enough to work but jams often
customer_reviews.text: I would expect this shredder to be able to handle tougher materials like cardboard that I need to shred but it doesn't like that. If you have strictly mail and credit cards to shred, this will do when fed slowly and carefully into the opening. The opening of the shredder is a bit thin so putting more than a few pieces of paper in at a time is difficult and the shredder sounds like it's having a heart attack. I'll keep it for light jobs, but wouldn't recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money, do not buy
customer_reviews.text: The CD/dvd shredder is terrible. Jammed on the 15th disc. The bucket is small. The noise level is high and the motor seemed like it was struggling. I tried a different brand and a larger model. I use it at home. I had a staples model for 10 years and it was strong and rock solid. I think you will need to spend double what this one costs for a decent actresses. I wanted micro cut with cd schredding.
customer_reviews.author: Board Games Rock

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but...
customer_reviews.text: I've been maintaining two households for a year; my shredder is at the other one. I finally got tired of my "shred pile" and ordered this. It works great but I have two issues. The first is the small size of the feed slot. In the photo it looks wider than it is; if you look closely the left side is blocked, which means you can't shred anything larger than a regular sheet of paper without folding it and you have to be careful to get your sheet of paper right in the slot. The basket is tapered and falls over easily on carpeted floor. 8 sheets is overly optimistic.
customer_reviews.author: dpidduck

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly..... up until it died just 6 weeks after purchase! ☹️
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly.... until it didn’t. This shredder was my “go to” for recycling paper products into pet bedding. Unfortunately, I was shredding a normal normal piece of paper one day and it just quite halfway through shredding it. The paper wasn’t thick or tough or any different than other pieces I’d shredded in the past with this machine. There was no error light indicating what was wrong (overheated, jam up, etc....), it just died. The return window expired May 31st and it quit working June 15th. This was an item that was purchased in “like new” condition from Amazon Warehouse. I am not happy. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: rtlueckTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works really well.
customer_reviews.text: I like this paper shredder, it's pretty quiet, and it does the job. I wouldn't put 12 sheets in it, it would probably break, but 5 to 6 sheets it slows down, but it does the job. Just a Note! If your looking to purchase a shredder, and I'm guessing you are, then if states 10, 15, 20 sheets, just do half of what it says, otherwise you'll be buying another shredder shortly. I've never seen one do what it says, but I have seen them break, when you try. I have no idea what paper thickness the manufactures are referring too, when they state the amount of sheets it will shred!
customer_reviews.author: Max Carrte'

customer_reviews.title: purchased summer 2018, still no issues
customer_reviews.text: for the record, I purchased a 4$ warranty with it, but that should not affect the quality of the product, ideally. my sole complaint about the shredder would be that the machine is heavy and the bin it sits on is very light, so emptying it without tipping the bin over as you take it apart is difficult. there's great potential for mess it destroys documents well though, and I know I looked at a bunch of models and this shredder was low- to mid-range as far as price. I think it was a really good deal (I paid 35usd + 4$ warranty)
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Works great and does what it claims -
customer_reviews.text: Has worked great. Not the most powerful, but it doesn't claim to be. Does exactly what it should. I knew the limitations when buying it and it shreds junk mail, documents, cards, etc. It has helped me clean up a space in my house that had been where I stacked stuff that I did not trust to go into the trash. The only weird thing, is some of the writing does not seem to line up correctly on the safety switch. I figured it out though. :)
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Continues to jam. Junk.
customer_reviews.text: Have used it exactly 10 times since purchase. Emptied container once, so we are not heavy users. Has already jammed 3 times where we had to use a screwdriver & pliers to get it going. This is a jam ftom ONE triple folded paper bill. Unfortunately return window is closed, or this would go back. Sure wish I opened it & used it sooner. JUNK.
customer_reviews.author: Buggsy

customer_reviews.title: Works well for small jobs.
customer_reviews.text: I had a pile of old tax returns and receipts and wanted to shred them. I was able to buy this unit for less than the local Office Depot was going to charge me to shed them. Not a fast process, just shreds a few pages at a time but does a good job and the price is cheap enough that it is a really good value. Would recommend this unit for small jobs. Units seems reliable and durable. I had no problems shredding 10 years worth of returns and receipts.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Plante

customer_reviews.title: Best Shredder Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This shredder is amazing! I had an entire large box of documents to shred and this thing eats through them like they are nothing! I shredded non stop for an entire hour with no problem at all. I only had to empty the bin and it even tells you when it is full! Cuts the paper in tiny little squares so the basket holds way more than my old cross-cut shredder. Very quiet operation and makes shredding easy! Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Diana P.

customer_reviews.title: Shred it...don't dread it !!
customer_reviews.text: This shredder is a "cut above" the rest. Makes confetti sized pieces. Not a single problem, and don't foresee any. If your mindful to pull out large staples, don't feed in paper clips and avoid shredding the plastic windows in envelopes...this shredder should last and last ! Very happy with this machine. The shredder head is substantially hefty and does a great job! Shreds credit cards with ease . Small enough to tuck away....quiet enough...and certainly does the job your want it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L Scalf

customer_reviews.title: Good shedder
customer_reviews.text: After reading several reviews on different shedders, I decided to try this one. I only do 1 sheet at a time, but they shred very quickly and it has not once heated up. I also just put some cooking oil on a piece of paper, fold it and send it through the shedder and then put it in reverse. This suggestion was in the instructions included with it. I have also done a few credit cards and they shredded very easily. I use this at home about once a week and I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew's mom

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: It works and I haven’t had any issues yet. But then again I don’t overload my shredder & I don’t shred the maximum amount of paper at one time either. Also I don’t let it heat up if big down. After all I paid a decent amount of money for & I want it to last. As for it not shredding the “advertised” number of sheets, I have NEVER come across ANY paper shredder that actually shreds the number of sheets it claims. No matter what brand or model, if it claims to shred 8 sheets the reality is 6 sheets. Claim 20, reality 15; claim 4, reality 2; and so on. I guess that’s just the paper shredder business.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet and shreds into small pieces
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my old shedder this one is on a whole different level. So glad my old one died or I might never have discovered the Aurora. It is quieter and faster than my old one and also more compact. I have not shredded that much to date but, I think it will be a real work horse. I like the fact that it does a micro-cut as I believe that offers more. security.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Trainer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly tough.  Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I have had excellent results with a small Aurora shredder for 8 years. Needed a larger unit with microcut to clean out a home office. Spent the better part of two weeks going through paper and shredding everything sensitive. Worked the unit very hard and it performed perfectly. I had no jams, overheating or other problems. Given the low price this unit exceeded all my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: D. Craig

customer_reviews.title: Paper eater
customer_reviews.text: What a monster shredder. Had another model from Aurora for ten years and a gear in it finally broke. They still make it like they used to. Heavy duty and shreds without complaint but it is a little noisy. I will deal with the noise based on this performance though.
customer_reviews.author: Erin A.

customer_reviews.title: Good shredder for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid shredder for the price. It will run about 5-8 minutes continuously. Not great if you have a lot to shred, but good if you're shredding things as they come in. I like the small footprint and it isn't too loud. Also, the microcuts are great. There's no way anyone is reconstructing your docs. Recommended unless you have multiple boxes to shred and limited time.
customer_reviews.author: R. Suss

customer_reviews.title: Can’t believe we went so long without this!
customer_reviews.text: Why didn’t I buy this years ago? I highly encourage everyone to shred everything and anything that has personal information on it (I was on a jury for identity theft - it’s incredible the horrendous things people do. Identity theft upturns lives like you wouldn’t believe.). This shredder absolutely does the trick and I love that it shreds hard cards just as well as paper. I’m glad I chose one that cross shreds as well. I’m grateful to have it! It’s given us no trouble even when I’ve accidentally put more papers through it than recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Kyra Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews on this item, I was somewhat skeptical of buying it. But it seemed to be closest to what I wanted (cross-cut and CD/DVD capable) at the price I wanted to pay, and so far it works great. It's not as loud as I expected, and it has shredded everything I've fed into it, although I have kept the number of sheets down to less than half of what's specified. Taking a bit longer to do the shredding sure beats having to replace the shredder!
customer_reviews.author: DoctorB

customer_reviews.title: Working right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I had been accumulating a lot of documents that needed shredding. The initial shredding session filled the wastepaper basket that comes with it. No problem, no binding, no overheating. Probably shredded for 30 minutes non stop. Multipage bills/statements went through ok. I don't know about 8 pages at once, the most I put through at once was 4. Worth the price (assuming it lasts). But the initial results were impressive and at a reasonable price point.
customer_reviews.author: PCM

customer_reviews.title: Unit bogs down with 3 or 4 sheets of paper!
customer_reviews.text: The ad for this shredder claims "8 sheet micro-cut" good luck with that. I found that inserting only 3 to 4 sheets of regular copy paper makes the unit struggle to get the job done. Gray plastic on the top of the unit must be opened to insert paper, however it only opens slightly making it a bit difficult to place the paper in the machine. It does a good job of micro-shredding paper and credit cards. However, CD's are only sliced several times .
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye45

customer_reviews.title: I love this little shredder
customer_reviews.text: This shredder is perfect for me. It does a great job, is fast and even tho the instructions said you could put 6 pages at a time in it, I generally put only 2. When the bottom part got full of paper and I wanted to empty it, I put a hand on each side of the top and lifted it...could not get the top off; read instructions and it didn't tell you how to remove the top. As a last resort, I grabbed hold of the "handle" on top ...sure enough, it was a handle.
customer_reviews.author: Argyle 8

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but very flimsy bin
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in January 2020 and received in February. Love the power of the shredder; however after only three uses the top of the bin split causing the front window to fall out. The bin was only half way full. It seems that the weight of the shredder was too heavy and/or there was a serious weak spot. The one star given for value and sturdiness are directly related to this problem, because like I said, powerful, but unusable without the bin.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great personal shredder, flimsy trash bin, can't shred chip cards
customer_reviews.text: It's great for shredding personal documents and pretty quick too. Though it's incredibly top-heavy, and the trash bin is quite light. It's sitting out of the way for me but I could see the weight distribution making it easy to tip over. I'm also very surprised it can't shred chip cards. Nobody has cards without chips anymore.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: I started not to order this product because of some of the negative reviews; however, I realize not everyone can be pleased and sometimes you just might get a lemon -- it happens. So, I did order and received it quickly. Have been using it for about 3 months now and it has performed perfectly. Have had zero issues to this point. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good cross-cut shredder.
customer_reviews.author: radman

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well thus far. I just got done shredding a whole box of junk mail and had to empty the shred box twice. The shredder never got jammed/clogged up. It says it can do 8 sheets of paper at once, but for thicker paper this would obviously not be true. I use my shedder mostly for junk mail and for me It comfortably did two tri-folded pieces of mail at a time. It also shreds into small compact pieces so when you go to dump them out they don't fly everywhere, which for me is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hollar

customer_reviews.title: Strained power, microcut is nice though
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent shredder for very low volume users. It sounds strained to handle even three or four sheets of paper. Loved the microcut but returned it for a stronger quieter shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Pat B.

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it -- Lasted 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: I decided to upgrade from our cheaper models that never broke with heavy use, because I wanted to be fancy. Bad idea. With this shredder, my husband complained constantly about how noisy it was every single time. In the past year, we used this a total of four times before the motor broke this past weekend when I finally decided to attack the growing pile of paper clutter. During every use, the feeder jammed, and the reverse function barely worked. Go cheap or fancy, but go elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper73

customer_reviews.title: Works a charm
customer_reviews.text: This was my first shredder, so I didn't quite know what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised. I've done about 300 pounds so far, cleaning out my office, so it has more than paid for itself. I imagine this is true of most shredders, that while it will grind through 8 pages at a time, it slows down to do so. It is faster to feed one or two sheets at a time, which it zips through. I did have one jam, and customer service was prompt, easy to reach, and super helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have been in love with this shredder since I got it a couple of weeks ago. We have a small apartment and it is compact and not bulky. It also shreds really well. My partner laughed at me because I walked around for days saying how much I loved this shredder. I use it to shred mail and other documents. I don't feel like I need a bigger shredder or anything (and to be honest, it probably shreds better than the one we have at work). This thing is perfect if you want to shred mail and/or you only use it occasionally--which is what we'll be using it for.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela Ortiz Flores

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I finally bought a shredder! This item is pretty sweet! The micro cut is awesome! I’ve never been one to constantly shred so it hasn’t overheated. I shredded a good amount my first go and it warmed up but never got too hot. A very nice, compact size!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Another Good Fellows Product
customer_reviews.text: As an inveterate reader of product reviews, I am concerned when I read about the difficulties some purchasers have with products that come damaged, nonperforming or short lived. I am sure that in this day and age there is some chance that any product will have a problem. However, having had good success with my previous Fellows shredder, in this case I went with the significant number of positive reviews and have been delighted. This shredder is amazingly quiet and efficient, easily shredding three to four pages at a time seemingly endlessly without shutting down and produces a much more compact product to throw out.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Kosk

customer_reviews.title: Cool little thing
customer_reviews.text: This is my first shredder. My family likes it, my only issue is that after putting an unopened mail that was slightly thick in the shredder we had a paper jam. If it got a paper jam then I am wondering if it will also jam with a credit card too (even though it is designed to shred credit cards). Over all, I like it and Its very easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: KimNYC

customer_reviews.title: Solid unit with just one flaw
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. However this particular unit feels too heavy on my average height carpet. Basket is tall and narrow and while it does not fall over I have it positioned In A place where it won’t be bumped as I am afraid it will tip over and make a mess. I do t feel it is a hazard but could be inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: c.reid

customer_reviews.title: Broken within a month.
customer_reviews.text: Only owned this a month and it stopped working already. I never tried more than 7 pages at a time and never shredded credit cards or anything so I’m kinda upset this happened. Called customer service a week ago and nobody has called me back. Don’t spend your money on this. You will end up having to buy another one like I have to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: terrible terrible buy... barely used for 5 moths and it's dead, feed sapper back in and stops
customer_reviews.text: this thing has worked so-so for a total of 5 months and is now dead. I feed 2-3 sheets at a time and it back-feeds itself and then has to shut down. impossible to clear the jams of shredded pieces, probably because the paper does not shred into small pieces as billed, but in strips that get caught in the mechanism. terrible buy -- nothing like the one I have for several years before. don't buy it!!
customer_reviews.author: Olsz

customer_reviews.title: Great at first unitl...
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for 3 weeks and it’s already broken. I was working great at first but then after putting a Walgreens Rx paper receipt that has all my sensitive info on it, it just jammed. I tried to “reverse” it so it would come out but it was stuck! It was difficult to get out after almost going through all the way. Spent the last hour trying to get it out and I can’t! So now I have to get a new one. Should of gotten a heavy duty one before and spend the money instead of having to pay almost triple now for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Rivera Arroyo

customer_reviews.title: Good power in a small device
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice machine for the size. So far no problems and I've been able to get through a ton of documents in a short amount of time. The only negative I have is that it was delivered with the basket broken. It has an orange sized hole cracked out of it which makes it unusable unless you use a liner. The manufacturer put it back on Amazon as a shipping issue and they pushed back at the manufacturer. Too much hassle.
customer_reviews.author: DeserayGoddess

customer_reviews.title: Basic home shredder.  Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Did not want to pay much for a home shredder. This arrived quickly. Packaged very well...no damage. I run just a page or two at a time of stuff I would rather not put in trash. I don't mind avoiding cellophane, stickers, paperclips, etc. to keep it running and save some money over buying a commercial duty unit. Glad I bought this...works fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: David W

customer_reviews.title: Who knew you could get excited about a shredder!
customer_reviews.text: I was waiting to get through tax season shredding to comment on this shredder. This is when it is really put to the test in our house. Overall this is durable and does the job seamlessly. It can go without overheating like others, but not indefinitely. You still need to take a break after ~10 minutes. I like the small crosscut pieces it makes for security purposes. Definitely happy about this shredder.
customer_reviews.author: T. J.

customer_reviews.title: Great for occasional very low volume only
customer_reviews.text: Granted I may have been using in high volume scenario. I bought this crosscut shredder to replace my less secure straight cut shredder. I bought the straight cut in 2006, which I used countless times under identical shredding loads. The crosscut broke in mid batch, so I completed batch with straight cut. Unfortunately I missed the window to return and only time I have available to call manufacturers 800 number doesn't line up with their support hours. My batches are the size of a box of standard 8.5 by 11 computer paper, so 10,000+ sheets. Crosscut never worked again. Straight cut going strong.
customer_reviews.author: AFC

customer_reviews.title: I've waited a long time for this.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this paper shredder! I've been without one for a couple of years and have several boxes of papers to shred. I got to work straight out of the box with this. All I had to do was put the lid on the wastebasket, plug it in, and go. It cross-shreds paper into tiny bits and has great power. Guess what I'm gonna be spending time doing over the next couple of weeks? Shredding marathon!!! :)
customer_reviews.author: reignbough1973

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in this shredder.  Loud, inconvenient.
customer_reviews.text: The slot to put the paper in is placed so that it's not convenient to slide standard-size paper in and it's also tricky to get smaller items (receipts, etc.) to "catch" and start shredding. This unit is loud, and if it weren't such a pain to repack it and return it, I wouldn't keep it. Update: Had this shredder for a while, and I still hate it. The paper does not feed easily. If you don't insert it just right, it will just grind away loudly. Horrible shredder.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: shredder
customer_reviews.text: Works like it's supposed to. I like the cross shredding Bogs down a little with over 4 pages. This appears to be a good home unit. If you're in an office situation, I'd suggest going for a commercial unit. Also re: oiling it....I got a small squirt bottle and filled it with canola oil. Run a tiny line of it across the feed area followed with a piece or two of paper. Oil bottled for shredders is a ripoff as is the lubed paper.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin R. Werchan

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: They have stopped recycling paper in our area so I decided to get a shredder so I could shred the paper and use it for mulch (it works really well as mulch). This shredder is fantastic. It doesn't just shred the paper into long strips, the paper is shredded into small pieces like confetti so it makes great mulch. It also shreds paper from large bundles to small bags of shred and I'm saving room in the landfill as well as reusing the paper. I am very pleased with this shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Akitalady

customer_reviews.title: This little shredder makes tiny little pieces out of sheets of paper fed into it.
customer_reviews.text: Be sure you do not want whatever you are going to shred, because you can't put it back together if you change your mind. The paper is shredded into pieces about 1/2 inch by 1/8 inch and it looks even smaller due to the way the machine is able to wad up the 1/2 inch by 1/8 inch strip into a very small piece of paper. You can only feed one sheet of paper at a time, but the machine is very efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M.

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty happy with this compact paper shredder. It works well to shred old mail and receipts, including credit cards with a chip in it. The most I’ve run it consistently is for about 30mins. Tip: I make sure to oil the shredder part after each use, I spray a bit of wd40 onto the blades after I’m done to keep it oiled for the next time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Camilo Sol Zamora

customer_reviews.title: Noisy but good
customer_reviews.text: Overall rating is 4.5 stars Pros: shreds with ease. microcut is the way to go. ive ran about 50 sheets so far and the bin is not even a 1/4 full. Have not tried credit cards yet Cons: noisy Emptying bin requires to remove the shredder from the bin. Next time I will get one that has a pullout bin. I think i may have got a returned item. the box had a red sticker.
customer_reviews.author: Network guy

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far.
customer_reviews.text: This shredder arrived this afternoon and I promptly used it to shred enough paper to half fill a 30 gallon plastic trash bag. I stopped a few times, waiting the required 30 minutes, to avoid the 5 minute limit - but the red light never came on. The shreds were as fine as advertised, and the machine seemed to handle the 4 sheets or so I fed it each time (not 8). This is not the heavy duty GSA shredder I used a long time ago on a highly classified project, but it is more than adequate for home use. The price is certainly right!
customer_reviews.author: Ira

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Love the micro cut feature, bit the overheat light comes on after about 10 minutes of shredding. Then you need to wait at least 30 minutes for it to cool down and for the overheat light to go out before you can use it again. Also, it struggles to shred the 8 pages it says you can shred at one time. This was supposed to be an upgrade for me from a cheaper shredder I had that finally died. But it feels like a downgrade and doesn't perform as well as the much cheaper brand I used before.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cordone

product_meta.title: Aurora AU820MA High Security 8-Sheet Professional Micro-Cut Paper/CD/Credit Card Shredder
product_meta.description: Color:8-Sheets/CDAU820MA 8-Sheet Micro-Cut Paper / Credit Card/CD Shredder Ideal for the medium duty needs of the small business or home office, this Micro-Cut shredder delivers performance and extra security level shredding. Features Shred Safe technology where a safety power shut-off will engage when "forced entry" is detected. When not in use, the cover plate closes the feed entry. Durable steel cutters shred documents up to 8 sheets of paper and a dedicated feed slot enables CD destroying. Includes an integrated handle for easy emptying of the 4.8 gallon wastebasket.
feature_bullets: "ShredSafe" advanced safety feature: Auto power-off upon forced entry, prevent accident
Allows continuous shredding for up to 5 minutes. LED "Power / Overheat / Overload / Misaligned" status indicator lights
Shreds CDs/ DVDs, Credit cards; Small paper clips ; Staples
Auto start / stop. Overload / Overheat protection. Security Level P-4 (sensitive and confidential information)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,432 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
